urls.title: Walleys Quarry ‚Äì Staffordshire Landfill
urls.description: Walleys Quarry offers customers a safe disposal method for waste that cannot be otherwise re-used or recycled. Our team of experts carefully manage and monitor the site through a set of tight controls and procedures to the highest standards and ensure compliance with all legal and governmental policies and regulations. We work to minimise any impact on the environment now and for the future of the site. The Walleys Quarry community fund has distributed over ¬£1.7m to community and environmental projects

tweets.text: @BrazierMary We have reviewed the application to the @EnvAgency for tunnel approval. The document and the supporting reports are missing critical borehole logs and reports around the sensitive R Misbourne crossing locations at Chalfont St Giles and Shardeloes Lake.

Serious questions for @EnvAgency as council chief reveals levels of hydrogen sulphide at landfill were at dangerous levels in May last year - @AaronBell4NUL says it has been too slow https://t.co/4fqu2dsZon

Stokies - report the toxic poisonous landfill gases that cause health harms (and also have an unpleasant odour)  to the @EnvAgency & the council, details below @jogideon #stopthestink https://t.co/6wzTocSIKR

We want more transparency, more communication & don‚Äôt want to be treated as ignorant fools. It‚Äôs abundantly clear that it‚Äôs our health & environment that are at stake here #stopthestink @PHE_uk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/17d9FowMOP

@tayz_BETH @SianieRoo @pow_rebecca @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @StaffordshireCC @NewsNBC @BBCNews @StinkStopthe So does the entire borough , with that oh so nasty eggy smell !! We do prefer the term poisonous gas in our little backwater .
